alert.note: Alert for Baker; Calhoun; Decatur; Dougherty; Early; Grady; Miller; Mitchell; Seminole; Worth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 1:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Houston County in southeastern Alabama, northeastern Decatur, northwestern Grady, Miller, southern Dougherty, Mitchell, Baker, southeastern Calhoun, central Early, northern Seminole Counties in southwestern Georgia and southwestern Worth Counties in south central Georgia through 200 PM EDT/100 PM CDT/... At 115 PM EDT/1215 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Leary to near Colquitt to 11 miles east of Cottonwood. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Cottonwood, Newton, Donalsonville, Camilla, Pelham, Bainbridge, Baconton, Leary, Douglasville, Gordon, Iron City, Damascus, Brinson, Jakin, Iveys Mill, Crosby, Lester, Donaldsonville A/P and Greenough. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/ for southeastern Alabama...the Panhandle of Florida...and south central and southwestern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Calhoun; Decatur; Dougherty; Early; Grady; Miller; Mitchell; Seminole; Worth
